answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Methotrexate can cause opportunistic infections, so the likely hood of hepatitis cannot be ruled out. Have a liver function tests and a hepatitis panel done. The commonest side effect of Methotrexate usage is nausea. Hepatitis too causes nausea and loss of appetite. Other causes for your symptoms like diabetes need to be ruled out. Discuss these options with your consulting doctor.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: I have been on Methotrexate for about 4 years for an auto-immune eye disease.  I also take acetominiphen and Diclofenac daily because of pain related to several back and neck surgeries.  About six months ago, I began to experience episodes in which I feel faint, over-heated, shaky and I have visual disturbance.  If I eat something immediately, it only lasts about 30 minutes.  I'm thinking this is hypoglycemia and I'm wondering if it has developed because of possible damage to my liver from the meds I take.  If so, what kind of doctor should I see who could determine if the liver condition is the problem?  Also, do you have any dietary suggestions?
title: Drug induced liver disease and hypoglycemia
